semantic_identifier: 23: feat: Server-side immutable audit logging for customer signal reads & exports (PII access)

sections.text:
## Description

Implements immutable/append-only audit logs for read access to customer signals that may contain PII.

Changes included:
- Adds an `access_audit_logs` datastore/table designed for append-only writes (no update/delete paths from the app layer) with fields: workspace_id, actor_type (user/service), actor_id, occurred_at, action (API_READ/UI_VIEW/EXPORT), resource_type, resource_id(s), request_id, ip, user_agent, and metadata (endpoint/query/export format).
- Instruments PII-relevant read surfaces:
  - API endpoints that fetch raw customer signal records.
  - UI endpoints/routes used to render raw signal record views.
  - Export/download endpoints (CSV/JSON/etc.).
- Captures request context via middleware (request_id, IP, user agent) and propagates to audit logging calls.
- Adds admin-only retrieval endpoints:
  - `GET /admin/audit-logs` with basic filters: time range (from/to), actor (type/id), workspace, resource_type/resource_id, action.
  - Pagination + deterministic ordering by occurred_at.
- Enforces authorization so only workspace admins (or platform admins) can query audit logs; standard users cannot access logs.
- Adds tests covering: log emission for each access type, immutability guarantees at the application layer, and admin-only access controls.

Notes:
- Logging is best-effort and non-blocking for read paths (failures do not prevent reads/exports); failures are surfaced via server logs/metrics.
- No UI changes are included beyond server-side support; admin retrieval is via API for now.

## How Has This Been Tested?

staging
